The map method

A value which has a Functor must provide a map method. The map method takes one argument.

u.map(f)
  1. f must be a function,
    1. If f is not a function, the behaviour of map is unspecified.
    2. f can return any value.
  2. map must return a value of the same Functor.

1st Law: Identity

u.map((a) => a) is equivalent to u

export identity = (f) -> for-all(Int).satisfy (a) -> ((f a).map (b) -> b).is-equal (f a)

2nd Law: Composition

u.map((a) -> f(g(a)) is equivalent to u.map(f).map(g)

export composition = (f) -> for-all(Int).satisfy (a) -> g = (* 2) h = (- 1) return ((f a).map (b) -> g (h b)).is-equal (f a).map(h).map(g)
